extracted_rules.rule: Vaulted Entry Feature Definition and Gross Floor Area (GFA) Calculation

Qualifiers.Scope: This rule defines 'vaulted entry features' and stipulates how their area is calculated towards the gross floor area.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to all building entry features.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: The rule applies 'regardless of the design (including whether or not they are open)'.

Variables.Dimensional: entry_feature_height: The vertical distance of the entry feature. entry_feature_footprint_area: The floor area of the entry feature. gross_floor_area: The total gross floor area of the building.
Variables.material: top_of_roof_material: The material at the top of the roof, used as the upper measurement point for height. outside_material_of_entryway: The material on the exterior of the entryway, used as the boundary for footprint area measurement.
Variables.environmental: Grade: The ground level used as the starting point for height measurement. (Ambiguous: The specific definition of 'Grade' is not provided in the text).

Constants.Numerical values: Height Threshold: 12 feet. Gross Floor Area Multiplier: 2 (counts twice).
Constants.procedures: Height Measurement Procedure: Measure the vertical distance from 'Grade' to the 'intersection of front facade and top of roof material' as illustrated in Figure 6. Footprint Area Measurement Procedure: Measure the area to the 'outside material of the entryway feature', ensuring to include any portion of the entryway that is 'recessed beyond the house facade and roof'.

Conditions.Mandatory: If an entry feature meets the height criteria for a 'vaulted entry feature', its footprint area MUST be counted twice towards the gross floor area.
Conditions.Conditional logic: IF entry_feature_height > 12 feet THEN the feature is classified as a 'vaulted entry feature'. IF feature is a 'vaulted entry feature' THEN its contribution to gross_floor_area = entry_feature_footprint_area * 2.
Conditions.Dependencies: The calculation of gross floor area is dependent on the measured height of any entry features.

Exceptions.Special cases: The rule explicitly preempts special cases based on design (e.g., open vs. closed features) by stating it applies 'regardless of the design'.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific sub-component of the broader regulations for calculating a building's total Gross Floor Area.
Relationships.Cross-references: The rule explicitly references 'Figure 6' for measurement methodology. It also mentions 'Figure 6 - 8', implying additional related figures that are not included in the provided text.
Relationships.Logical dependencies: The application of the GFA multiplier (x2) is logically dependent on the outcome of the height comparison (height > 12 feet).
